answers.answer: microvascular ischemic changes are related to small areas of infarct in the very small perforating vessels in the deeper parts of the brain (the white matter). This can be seen in relation to a variety of different diseases including stroke, diabetes, hypertension, and high cholesterol. White matter changes can also be seen in infectious processes as well as in multiple sclerosis.In medicine, infarction refers to tissue death (necrosis) caused by a local lack of oxygen due to obstruction of the tissue's blood supply.
